channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Macron calls shocking snap election in France; AI models compete in pageant
item.description: French President Macron calls for a snap election after defeat in EU vote. AI models are competing in the inaugural Miss AI pageant
item.content:encoded:
French President Macron calls for a snap election after defeat in EU vote. AI models are competing in the inaugural Miss AI pageant

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Takeaways from the European parliamentary elections
item.description: Results indicate a surge of support for parties that are far to the right of the political spectrum. However, the largest political groupings in the next parliament will continue to be in the center.
item.content:encoded:
Results indicate a surge of support for parties that are far to the right of the political spectrum. However, the largest political groupings in the next parliament will continue to be in the center.

(Image credit: Michael Probst)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: European parliamentary election results offer a glimpse into EU priorities
item.description: Voters have decided who they want to represent them in the European Parliament, a decision that will shape the European Union for the coming years.
item.content:encoded: Voters have decided who they want to represent them in the European Parliament, a decision that will shape the European Union for the coming years.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Hostages are rescued in Gaza, Israeli war cabinet shakeup
item.description: A weekend operation by Israel in Gaza freed four hostages held by Hamas. Gaza health authorities say the raid also took the lives of more than 270 Palestinians.
item.content:encoded: A weekend operation by Israel in Gaza freed four hostages held by Hamas. Gaza health authorities say the raid also took the lives of more than 270 Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: More cities are banning right turns on red in response to rising pedestrian deaths
item.description: Turning right at a red light has been common since the fuel embargo of the 1970s, but some city officials say they don't make sense in urban areas.
item.content:encoded: Turning right at a red light has been common since the fuel embargo of the 1970s, but some city officials say they don't make sense in urban areas.
item.dc:creator: Ally Schweitzer

item.title: Power grids in the western U.S. are forced to handle rising temperatures
item.description: How are power grids in the western U.S. handling the current heat dome, and what needs to happen to ensure that power grids can keep up with rising temperatures and extreme weather?
item.content:encoded: How are power grids in the western U.S. handling the current heat dome, and what needs to happen to ensure that power grids can keep up with rising temperatures and extreme weather?
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Climate change is deadly. Exactly how deadly? Depends who's counting
item.description: Multiple federal and state government agencies count the number of deaths from extreme floods, wildfires, heat waves and hurricanes. They don't always agree on which deaths should be counted.
item.content:encoded:
Multiple federal and state government agencies count the number of deaths from extreme floods, wildfires, heat waves and hurricanes. They don't always agree on which deaths should be counted.

(Image credit: Arden S. Barnes)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher

item.title: Once called Nantucket fever, this nasty tick-borne illness is on the rise
item.description: Once called Nantucket fever, the tick-borne illness babesios is spreading from the Northeast into the Midwest. A clinical trial starts this month to see if an anti- malaria drug can treat the disease.
item.content:encoded:
Once called Nantucket fever, the tick-borne illness babesios is spreading from the Northeast into the Midwest. A clinical trial starts this month to see if an anti- malaria drug can treat the disease.

(Image credit: Ladislav Kubeš)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Biden visits a military cemetery that Trump reportedly said was 'filled with losers'
item.description: The Aisne-Marne WWI cemetery in France has become a staple in President Biden's political speeches, used to paint an unflattering picture of former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The Aisne-Marne WWI cemetery in France has become a staple in President Biden's political speeches, used to paint an unflattering picture of former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Food and Drug Administration advisers are reviewing the Alzheimer's drug Donanemab
item.description: FDA advisers are set to review an Alzheimer's drug found to slow the disease's progress in patients in the early stages. The big questions are about how the drug should be marketed.
item.content:encoded: FDA advisers are set to review an Alzheimer's drug found to slow the disease's progress in patients in the early stages. The big questions are about how the drug should be marketed.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton
